summary: Feebleminded scanlan after going on a relaxing post retirement adventure with pike and grog where they gotta wait a bit to fix...
question: Feebleminded scanlan after going on a relaxing post retirement adventure with pike and grog where they gotta wait a bit to fix him. Or if you havent seen the first game, nott is feebleminded, seperated from the rest of the group besides jester, and jester has no magic left to fix her until later. I just woke up, sorry if this makes no sense.
answer:
(you asked and so i shall deliver don’t worry lol i gotcha)

“Oh, there you are, Scanlan,” says Pike.

They stumble upon him in the middle of a sun-dappled clearing, sitting in the tall grass among a field of wildflowers. His lute is resting on the ground beside him, and birds sing from the sprawling forest trees around them. He holds a poppy between his tiny fingers, and his head turns slowly towards them.

His face lights up. He waves, and it’s the lack of a witty comment, a soft greeting, even a cheerful ‘hello’ that lets them know that something is wrong.

“Scanlan?” Grog asks, and takes a step closer.

The gnome blinks a few times. Then he smiles, and points excitedly at the sea of wildflowers surrounding him.

Pike and Grog exchange glances.

They rush over.

Scanlan seems confused by their rapid approach, their quick movement and their slightly panicked tones as Pike kneels down next to him and Grog takes a seat and they ask:

“Scanlan, are you alright?”

“What’s wrong, mate?”

He looks up at them with bright brown eyes. He beams.

They exchange glances again.

“Scanlan?” Pike asks, resting a hand on his shoulder. “Can you…can you understand me?”

He seems to consider this for a moment. Then he leans in, presses a kiss to her nose, and tucks a scarlet flower behind her ear. He pulls away, and frowns at the worried expression on her face. He makes a sound, but instead of any words, any of the words that would normally spin from his lips and twirl from his tongue, there is only the quiet whimper of concern, and confusion.

Pike is arguably one of the most powerful clerics in this realm. She knows, instantly, what the problem is.

She leans back, plopping down into the grass and shaking her head. “That sorcerer must’ve gotten in a Feeblemind before we finished her off,” she says. “Is that why you ran off, Scanlan?”

He passes her a bluebell, which she accepts with a sigh.  

“So that’s fine, then, right?” Grog asks as he is handed a zinnia. “You can just heal him, right?”

Pike yanks out her component pouch and starts rummaging around. After a moment, she produces a small glass vial, which she holds up to the afternoon sunlight.

“Damn,” she says. “I’m out of diamond dust. We’ll have to go home and get more. Sorry, Grog. I know how excited you were about this adventure.”

He laughs, and shakes his head. “It’s fine, Pikey-poo. If we’ve gotta fix Scanlan, we’ve gotta fix Scanlan. ‘Sides, we can just do this later, right?”

She grins. “Of course, Grog. ‘Cmon, old man,” she adds to Scanlan as they both stand up and dust the grass off their armor and leathers. “Let’s get you home and fixed up.”

Grog hefts them both up onto his shoulders, and Scanlan laughs delightedly as he is swung into the air. He leans into the crook of Grog’s neck, presses a sun warmed-cheek against the goliath’s smooth, cool head.

“You know,” says Pike as they exit the clearing, “this is probably the calmest I’ve ever seen him.”

“It’s kinda weird,” says Grog, “but yeah. I know what you mean.”

Later on, after Pike fishes more dust out of a cabinet in their kitchen—perhaps it was strange to keep spell components next to the spice rack, but for their odd family it worked—she tosses a glittering cloud above Scanlan’s head and while he squeezes his eyes shut and sneezes, she presses a hand to both of his cheeks and a soft glow of golden energy washes over his body.

There is a moment’s pause.

Then Scanlan opens his eyes, and sees Pike and Grog peering intently at him, and grins his usual, charismatic grin.

“When did we get attacked by a druid?” he asks. “Why are you both covered in flowers?”

summary: Huh
body:
Huh

Just finished my relisten of e105 then searched for it on reddit because I knew this was one of the spicy ones, and the amount of very long posts about Keyleth by people who do not understand how people work is pretty incredible.
